title: Six-Month Overlap Exceeded

scenario_info.name: Moving Between Homes - Overlap Exceeded
scenario_info.description: Jennifer buys a new home before selling her old one, but takes 8.5 months to sell the old home, exceeding the 6-month overlap allowance by 74 days.

expected_result.notes: 74 days of overlap period taxable on one property

applicable_rules: Overlap of 257 days exceeds 183-day limit by 74 days
Must choose which property loses exemption for excess period
Old home taxable for 74 days (smallest proportion)

property_history.description: Moving to new home in Ascot

properties.notes: Old home - overlap period of 257 days (8.5 months) exceeds 6-month limit. 74 days are taxable.
New home - keeping as main residence. Not being sold.

user_query: I bought a new home in February 2024 and moved in immediately, but didn't sell my old home until October 2024. The overlap was about 8.5 months. What is my CGT position on the old home?
